edu.unm.health.biocomp.hscaf

Class ScaffoldSet

  • Object
    • ScaffoldSet

  • public class ScaffoldSet
extends Object
    Represents a set of unique HierS scaffolds . Purpose of this class is to
    1. Store set of scaffolds, compactly, generated for input molecular dataset, for output .
    2. Optimize generation of scaffolds by avoiding repitition of prior analyses.
    IDs are consecutive and start at 1. Child scaffolds are not separate instances but rather among the set and may be shared. Developer note: scafhash and idhash contain references to the same Scaffold objects, thereby conserving memory.
    Note that the ScaffoldStore class is an alternative utilizing BerkeleyDB for improved performance and memory management for large datasets.
    Author:
    Jeremy J Yang
    See Also:
    Scaffold, ScaffoldTree, hier_scaffolds_utils, hier_scaffolds, hscaf_utils

      Scaffold getScaffoldByID(long id)

      Returns ID of Scaffold with same cansmi if present, null otherwise.
      Set<String> keySet()
      Returns Set of cansmi strings.
      int mergeScaffoldTree(Scaffold scaf)
      Merges a complete [sub]ScaffoldTree defined by the Scaffold argument with the ScaffoldSet. New scaffolds are assigned new IDs, which is the main purpose of this method. Existing scaffolds are recognized as such, should have IDs, since found during hscaf_utils.findChildScaffolds. Initially called with new root scaffold, then recursively. For each call, process all immediate child scaffolds, then recurse. Child scaffolds present in set are same instances, not only equal. Returns number of new scaffolds merged.

      • mergeScaffoldTree

        public int mergeScaffoldTree(Scaffold scaf)
        Merges a complete [sub]ScaffoldTree defined by the Scaffold argument with the ScaffoldSet. New scaffolds are assigned new IDs, which is the main purpose of this method. Existing scaffolds are recognized as such, should have IDs, since found during hscaf_utils.findChildScaffolds. Initially called with new root scaffold, then recursively. For each call, process all immediate child scaffolds, then recurse. Child scaffolds present in set are same instances, not only equal. Returns number of new scaffolds merged.
